page.title: 03THE CHURCH
page.content: Youlgrave church was built in Norman times. The tall broad tower is one of the most impressive in Derbyshire. The font is the only one in England with a stoup attached to its side (there is a replica at Elton nearby). The lady chapel at the north is dedicated to King Charles the Martyr. The chancel contains the tomb of Sir Thomas Cockayne. Thomas Cockayne died before his father, that's why his tomb is smaller than it should be. A carving of a knight with his heart in his hand covers the tomb of a knight who supposedly carried the heart of Robert the Bruce to the Holy Land. There is a peal of eight bells, the heaviest of which weighs well over a ton. The stained glass window at the east was designed by Sir Edward Burne-Jones. Other windows are by Charles Kempe. Daniel Panichella (10)
